results.title: New Era Begins at Warner Bros., Tinged With Nostalgia
results.abstract: With a new owner, the 99-year-old movie studio appears headed back to its traditional sweet spot as an entertainment company. But the business of Hollywood is no longer the same.

multimedia.caption: David Zaslav, Discovery’s chief executive, will run the new company, which is called, with no small amount of symbolism, Warner Bros. Discovery.
David Zaslav, Discovery’s chief executive, will run the new company, which is called, with no small amount of symbolism, Warner Bros. Discovery.
David Zaslav, Discovery’s chief executive, will run the new company, which is called, with no small amount of symbolism, Warner Bros. Discovery.

results.title: Laurence Fishburne Cools Down With Classic Jazz and Cashmere Blankets
results.abstract: The actor is back on Broadway for a revival of David Mamet’s “American Buffalo.” He discusses his other must-haves, like a chef’s knife, trampolines and crystals.

results.title: Will Smith Barred From Attending Oscars for 10 Years After Slap
results.abstract: Smith, who won best actor this year, can still be nominated for Oscars, industry officials said, but will be unable to attend the Academy Awards ceremony and other events.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

multimedia.caption: Will Smith struck the comedian Chris Rock at the Academy Awards after taking offense at a joke, stunning viewers and overshadowing the awards ceremony.
Will Smith struck the comedian Chris Rock at the Academy Awards after taking offense at a joke, stunning viewers and overshadowing the awards ceremony.
Will Smith struck the comedian Chris Rock at the Academy Awards after taking offense at a joke, stunning viewers and overshadowing the awards ceremony.

results.title: Ke Huy Quan: From Short Round to Romantic Lead in Just Four Long Decades
results.abstract: A child star in the 1980s, he hit a dry patch and turned to stunt work in the 2000s. Now he has returned to acting in a part that blends his action and drama chops.

multimedia.caption: “I didn’t grow up wanting to be an actor,” Ke Huy Quan said. When he was older and determined to act, “there were just not a lot of offers.”
multimedia.copyright: Jennelle Fong for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “I didn’t grow up wanting to be an actor,” Ke Huy Quan said. When he was older and determined to act, “there were just not a lot of offers.”

results.title: Kim’s Video Is Back. What Even Is a Video Store in 2022?
results.abstract: Alamo Drafthouse made a deal for the seminal New York chain’s collection in an effort to turn rentals into a draw for moviegoers. Can one disrupted business help another?
results.byline: By Gabe Cohn and Adam Powell

multimedia.caption: The boxes and videos were separated at the original Kim’s. The Alamo team matched them up again.
The boxes and videos were separated at the original Kim’s. The Alamo team matched them up again.
The boxes and videos were separated at the original Kim’s. The Alamo team matched them up again.

results.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard to Face Off in Defamation Trial
results.abstract: Mr. Depp sued his ex-wife, Ms. Heard, for an op-ed she wrote in The Washington Post referring to herself as a “public figure representing domestic abuse.”

multimedia.caption: Johnny Depp’s lawsuit, which accuses his ex-wife, Amber Heard, of defaming him in a Washington Post op-ed, goes to trial on Monday.
Johnny Depp’s lawsuit, which accuses his ex-wife, Amber Heard, of defaming him in a Washington Post op-ed, goes to trial on Monday.

results.title: How a Fanny Pack Attacks in ‘Everything Everywhere All at Once’
results.abstract: Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert (a.k.a. Daniels) discuss an action sequence from their film starring Michelle Yeoh and Ke Huy Quan.

results.abstract: This month’s picks include a French high school comedy, a documentary about football-obsessed Syrian refugees, a Chinese slacker movie and more.

results.title: Michel Bouquet, Award-Winning French Actor, Dies at 96
results.abstract: One of his country’s great theater performers, he went on to appear in more than 100 films playing ordinary men whose outward blandness masked complicated lives.

multimedia.caption: Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.
Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.
Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.

results.title: ‘Mississippi Masala’: A Love Story Among the Displaced
results.abstract: In Mira Nair’s sweet, sexy film from 1991, an Indian American woman falls for a Black cleaner played charmingly, as ever, by Denzel Washington.

multimedia.caption: Sarita Choudhury and Denzel Washington in Mira Nair’s “Mississippi Masala.”

results.title: Let Him Entertain You: Billy Crystal Returns to Broadway
results.abstract: The comedian is starring in “Mr. Saturday Night,” a musical version of his 1992 movie about an aging performer who won’t accept that his time in the spotlight is up.

multimedia.caption: “The worst nightmare is, do you wake up one day and you’re not funny anymore?” Billy Crystal, 74, said of the anxiety that comes with being an aging comedian. “Do you wake up and you’re not relevant?”
multimedia.copyright: Philip Montgomery for The New York Times

results.title: National Endowment for the Humanities Announces $33.17 Million in Grants
results.abstract: In New York, the Tenement Museum, Women Make Movies, UnionDocs, LaGuardia Community College and more will receive funding.

multimedia.caption: The Lower East Side Tenement Museum is receiving $400,000 to support guided tours exploring the lives of African Americans and Irish immigrants in 19th-century New York City.

results.title: Idris Elba, Gamer (That’s Why He Was So Keen on ‘Sonic the Hedgehog 2’)
results.abstract: In a career of action movies and dramas, Elba embraced the chance to voice Knuckles, the brawny adversary in the new sequel. Just don’t ask him about 007.

multimedia.caption: Idris Elba said he was such a fan of video games like Sonic the Hedgehog that “when my agent called with this, he didn’t even get to finish his sentence. I was like, yes, absolutely.”
multimedia.copyright: Michael Tyrone Delaney for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Ambulance’ Review: Michael Bay Is Our Emergency Movie Technician
results.abstract: The action auteur’s latest opus stars Jake Gyllenhaal and Yahya Abdul-Mateen II as bank robbers who commandeer an unlikely getaway vehicle.

results.title: Nehemiah Persoff, Actor With a Familiar Face (and Voice), Dies at 102
results.abstract: His most prominent roles included three tenderly caring parents, but he was most associated with the dapper gangsters he portrayed in the movies and on television.

multimedia.caption: Nehemiah Persoff in the 1974 television movie “The Sex Symbol.” He was long one of most recognizable faces on TV, by face if not by name.

results.title: One Last Takeaway From ‘The Slap’: Leave Black Women’s Hair Alone
results.abstract: Lost in the Oscars fray is the hurt inflicted when a group is denigrated for a laugh. Chris Rock, who has examined this issue in a documentary, should have known better.

multimedia.caption: Jada Pinkett Smith at the Academy Awards. Chris Rock remarked from the stage about the way she wore her hair.
Jada Pinkett Smith at the Academy Awards. Chris Rock remarked from the stage about the way she wore her hair.
Jada Pinkett Smith at the Academy Awards. Chris Rock remarked from the stage about the way she wore her hair.

results.title: ‘Meat the Future’ Review: The Growth of a ‘Clean Meat’ Start-Up
results.abstract: In her new film, the documentarian Liz Marshall depicts the rise of Upside Foods, a company that produces meat from animal cells.

multimedia.caption: Uma Valeti, the leader of Upside Foods, who is taking animals out of the process of meat production, in the documentary from Liz Marshall.
Uma Valeti, the leader of Upside Foods, who is taking animals out of the process of meat production, in the documentary from Liz Marshall.

results.title: With Discovery merger pending, Warner Bros. chief Ann Sarnoff is set to leave.
results.abstract: Ms. Sarnoff became the first woman to hold the job in 2019, but Discovery’s C.E.O. is expected to take over at least some of her role himself.

multimedia.caption: Ann Sarnoff became chief executive of Warner Bros. in 2019 despite limited Hollywood experience.
Ann Sarnoff became chief executive of Warner Bros. in 2019 despite limited Hollywood experience.
